intro: Onosma echioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf scabious, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs and produces small, blue to purple flowers in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Onosma echioides is often found in dry, sunny grasslands and rocky soils, thriving in well-drained conditions.
